intro: Echinocarpus australis, commonly known as the Australian burr or sand bur, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its distinctive spiny fruits. The plant typically grows in sandy or coastal areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are pinnately compound, and it produces small white or greenish flowers. The spiny, woody fruits are adapted for dispersal by attaching to animals or clothing.
